topic.title: Unwanted Content
topic.body: How do I prevent unwanted content from being pushed to my peer like CP and warez and other things that are illegal in my country

topic.title: How do I switch ZeroMe hubs?
topic.body: Seems like my hub only has old messages on it...

topic.title: ricochet users
topic.body:
Anyone else use ricochet or retroshare or anything else distributed? I kinda want to start a group of people that share content across multiple distributed networks.


My ricochet is ricochet:j57reb2jri6j23qd

topic.title: irc channel
topic.body: Why is irc channel so dead? I guess people mostly talk here heh

1_1NTgaYjK2bh1axvruth8HqtGt6Pw5ab13x.body:
> [balancer73](#comment_35_1PniNzyi8fygvwyBaLpA9oBDVWZ5fXuJUw): Just delete all zites with unwanted content. And block users, who posted such content in ZeroMe.

does zerome block for all apps or just zerome?

> [waterrabbit](#comment_136_1LxkfGxtWhktAJ5WJ9ZnKxksTSH37qm8cC): Don't click on NSFW pics. (Normally they won't be downloaded unless you click on them and make ZeroNet request for them)Don't seed those illegal sites.

Do you only seed stuff you download? What does it mean when it says "pushing to peers"?

> [styromaniac](#comment_40_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): I don't click anything I don't know, and if I fail to do that and get any questionable content, I just delete it.

the 'pushing to peers' thing made me think that you push content to peers regardless of if they've already viewed it or not, but that could be a misunderstanding on my part.

1_1CMYxdit4qq9QGk9DYRu2ruRPd2YDGckH8.body:
I think it's actually improved.

aside: why is there a comment from nofish from february?
We just need more people here now

> [alaric](#comment_28_1HiyP7AD74uGuGBZLqhcmfQgwu5VC8nnYY): The novelty of ZeroNet as a safe haven for free speech is wearing off and the "edgy" racist spam has dropped off considerably - Mostly because they're not getting the reaction that they want. You'll still see plenty of racism and tinfoil theories, but at least it's more of a discussion and not just ascii swastikas. [...]

Yeah that's what I was thinking as well. There is no real incentive to spam here so eventually those types of people just go away

1_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY.body: I wonder why onion chat hasn't had any commits in over a year?

4_1NTgaYjK2bh1axvruth8HqtGt6Pw5ab13x.body:
> [ivesen](#comment_14_1NmkVyqBJX6a82YQFYkCNgQpE9AWsmeppp): turns out that irc relies on users actively using it, or having many many users.sadly that hasn't materialized on zeronet yet, but I'm sure it'll come around eventually.

I wonder why? There are like 8 billion people in the world and only a handful of distributed networks. Why are there only 5 of us? The maths just aren't working for me.
